intro: Torilis arvensis var. divaricata, commonly known as the bent-leaf hedge parsley, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with slender, branching stems that are often hairy. The leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, spherical fruits. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
